ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Homework was assigned on a weekly basis. The assignments typically took about 1-3 hours to complete.
about 10 hours
6 hours
8+ hrs/week
about 5- 8 hours a week working on the assignments assigned each week
2-3 hours, for the take-home final

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: strengths - practicalweakness - assignments were not very specific
The course covers an important aspect of data analysis. Unfortunately, the course is a little bit messy. Some homework did not really make sense.

The course is too rushed, and would benefit from having a lab component. Since homework was pass/fail, I felt that there were not as many comments provided. This made it difficult to gauge progress.The course , however, was a good balance of applied and theoretical topics.
Data sets should be made available online, which they were not.

I really enjoyed how this course focused on the 'applied' parts of survival analysis with descriptions of Prof. Makuch's past experiences and how he solved the problems he faced. I would have enjoyed more feedback on the HW assignments to ensure I was understanding the material properly before the final exam.

Application of concepts was good, but it sometimes is strange to mix the biostat and non-biostat students. Perhaps there could be an extra lab session to go over theory, or the biostat students could come tues/thurs and others could come only tues and cover the applied concepts but not the theory.
The course covered a reasonable amount of material considering the length of the class. The organization could have been better though.
Solid for basic understanding, good pace.
This course is focus on a very special data analysis method, I think we need more good examples about this, and the explain about the results of SAS for this methods.
it's a nice course, and I have learned how to do survival analysis. I hope more examples can be offered in this class in the future.

Strengths: The professor's teaching style is highly effective. Dr. Makuch makes you really want to listen to him and what he has to say because he has a lot of information, especially from his work experience in the industry and government.Weakness: This course could have definitely been semester long.

The course is a sufficient introduction to basic survival analysis. It provides a good depth into some topics (such as log rank test concerning to curves etc) but is lacking in some other aspects (such as survival probabilities etc). However, as the course is only half a semester it does a well for the time it has.
Overall it was a short course that focused and taught exactly what it was supposed to do.

I really enjoyed this course. I thought it provided me with some really valuable statistical knowledge regarding survival analysis. In a few short weeks, I felt like I got a really great overview on the topic and learned lots of useful SAS code.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Robert Makuch  strength - engaging lecturer, clear
Instructor: Robert Makuch  The instructor did not seem really interested by teaching this class.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Good instructor; extensive experience in analyzing survival data. Explains concepts well to students not in biostats.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  I really enjoy Prof. Makuch's relaxed teaching style - he really explained complex biostatistics in an easy-to-understand manner.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  In class explanations were good and Makuch returned to basic concepts to explain where it was requested.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch had a tendency to go off on random tangents, and never actually returned any of our homework assignments. I felt like attending lecture wasn't particularly helpful, as I learned more from going back over the lecture slides while doing the homework. Dr. Makuch also tended to assume too much of as, believing that we already knew about everything he was teaching us and skimming over the material.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Knows the materials, but maybe covers too much theory
Instructor: Robert Makuch  He has lots of experience on this topic, need to improve the use of SAS and explain the results.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  nice instructor skilled at survival analysis
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Very effective professor who knows his stuff.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Professor Makuch provides an easy to understand approach to beginning students in terms of the broad concepts in survival analysis. His background stories helped flesh out the course quite well.I would of liked to receive a week to complete the HW (rather than Thursday- or sometimes Friday- to Tuesday). A large workload made it sometimes difficult to plan another assignment on such short notice.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch is very good at explaining concepts clearly without using too much statistical jargon.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch was great. I appreciate his balance of teaching the non biostats and providing some interests for the biostaticians.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Excellent Teacher.Always cool and makes the class interesting

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch was a very good lecturer (especially for the biostatistics department). His assignments were fair, as was the final, and he was very accommodating to the students (we asked for a take home final and he obliged). I would have appreciated if the TA/prof had done the assignment before assigning it, however, because they weren't always able to answer the students questions.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: strengths - very helpful, good teacher
TA: Owais GilaniThe TA did a great job.
I did not receive comments on my homework before the final. It is unclear if I was on the right track before the final.
Owais is always very responsive, although sometimes there was not adequate time for him to grade the hw and give feedback (not his fault, but it was hard at times)

Owais Gilani was as helpful as he could be as a TA, always answering our questions to the best of his ability (though perhaps not nearly as helpful for the final exam). On the other hand, we never got any of our homework assignments returned (though fortunately the posted solutions were very helpful).
Owais is always helpful
good TA, detailed answer for each of the homework is provided.
Owais was very helpful and attentive to students' questions.
The TA was very helpful and accessible. He answered all my questions and was more than willing to help.
Owais was very responsive and helpful with my questions.
Owais was excellent and very helpful.
Good TA. Had a lot of knowledge and very helpful

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: recommend it. very practical and useful for all biostats students
Important class for student in the biostatistics class.
The course is an introduction to analyzing survival data. I would recommend it particularly to CDE and BIS students.
Good overview of survival analysis. At times confusing for non-biostat students.
Take it if you have to. Survival analysis is pretty important, but Dr. Makuch isn't a particularly exciting professor.
Good class with usefulness.
It a useful course for people who need to deal with such data.
It's such a good course that I am sure that I am going to recommend this course to my friends.

Yes, I would recommend Survival Analysis to anyone who is interested in learning how to learn practical skills in analyzing and interpreting data. Survival Analysis is helpful for individuals who would like to continue biostatistics (ex. clinical trials) or epidemiology. Your professoris great, fair, and wise. The take home final also relieved some burden of exams, too, and the course is completed before the week of the other finals.
If you are looking for a good introduction to survival analysis this is the course to take. I would definitely recommend this to students beginning to study the subject.
Good course very appopriate. Focused on the topic.
yes
